column2: SOUTH CAROLINA DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
column6: SC

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Speed limit signs are:
column6: service signs

column2: 2. When driving at night, drivers should:
column4: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.
column6: always use their high beams.

column2: 3. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: low clearance.
column8: a low place in the road.

column2: 4. This signal means:
column6: Move to the left

column2: 5. Which statement about tires is true?
column4: Tires with low air pressure have better traction, particularly when driving on wet pavement.
column6: High speed reduces stress and strain on tires.
column8: The tires on your vehicle must have good treads and otherwise be in safe condition.

column2: 6. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column6: hydroplaning.

column2: 7. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column6: no left turn

column2: 8. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: You must come to a complete stop.
column8: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.

column2: 9. Driving at excessive speed:
column4: does not increase the chance of a crash.
column6: improves your reaction time.

column2: 10. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

column2: 11. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column6: Warning signs

column2: 12. Taking a prescription drug while drinking alcohol:
column4: has no effect one way or the other.
column6: can make you unfit to drive.

column2: 13. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.

column2: 14. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you are not allowed to park here.

column2: 15. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 16. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column6: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column8: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 17. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 18. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column6: the direction they should travel.

column2: 19. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As far to the right as possible.
column6: On the right curb.
column8: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 20. This sign indicates:
column6: a cross road.

column2: 21. As the percentage of alcohol in your blood (BAC) increases, you become:
column6: more intoxicated.

column2: 22. Parking is not allowed:
column6: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column8: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.

column2: 23. Which of these statements about railroad crossings is true?
column4: You must stop at a railroad crossing when directed by a “flagman” or stop sign.
column6: It is against the law to go around lowered gates at a crossing.

column2: 24. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column6: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
column8: from a one-way street into a one-way street.

column2: 25. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.
column6: It prevents skidding.

column2: 26. To drive defensively, you must:
column6: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 27. Who is most at risk?
column6: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 28. When sharing the road with cyclists, you should:
column6: treat the cyclist as any other vehicle.

column2: 29. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column6: on the left shoulder of the road.
column8: near the left edge of the road.

column2: 30. If you've had a few beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:
column6: waiting several hours.
